# View Data

```{r}
nhanes <- read.csv("data/BMI714_NHANES2020_Data.csv", header = T)
nhanes_var_name <- read.csv("data/BMI714_NHANES_VariableDictionary.csv", header = T)
# Rename the columns in nhanes
colnames(nhanes) <- ifelse(colnames(nhanes) %in% nhanes_var_name$BMI_714_Variable_Name, 
                           nhanes_var_name$Variable_Name[match(colnames(nhanes),nhanes_var_name$BMI_714_Variable_Name)], 
                           colnames(nhanes))  # Keep names unchanged if not in mapping


nhanes %>% nrow()
```

## independent variable consideration
Dairy porduct used: Greater consumption of total dairy products prevention of weight gain in middle-aged and elderly women who are initially normal weight. https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4807700/

Type of Milk: 1%/skim milk is more common among overweight/obese preschoolers, potentially reflecting the choice of parents to give overweight/obese children low-fat milk to drink. Nevertheless, 1%/skim milk does not appear to restrain body weight gain between 2â€“4 years in this age range, emphasizing a need for weight-targeted recommendations with a greater evidence basis. https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4439101/
